column74: 1 additional off-street space required per ADU; no ADU parking required within 0.5 mile of major or frequent transit; City may waive parking when near transit and on-street parking capacity exists.
column77: No owner-occupancy requirement for ADUs under state law and SMC 20.40.210.
column79: Occupancy limited by building and fire code; not specified separately for ADUs.
column84: ADUs must meet Shoreline building, fire, and zoning codes; attached and detached units require proper fire separation and, where required, sprinklers.
column87: Transportation, park, and fire impact fees apply to ADUs at reduced rates; frontage improvements are not required for ADU-only projects.
column88: No direct affordability requirement for ADUs; see SMC 20.40.230 for bonuses.
column92: NR1: minimum lot size 2,500 sf; base building height 35 ft (40 ft with pitched roof). Front setback 10 ft, side setback 5 ft, rear setback 5 ft. Maximum hardscape 50% for one unit and 75% for two or more units. ADUs up to 1,200 sf, attached or detached, with alley flexibility for 0 ft side/rear setbacks.
column108: Conversions of existing spaces or structures to ADUs are allowed if current building, fire, and zoning codes are met; interior conversions may exceed 1,200 sf if the home and ADU share a roof on different floors.
column109: Each lot may have up to two ADUs; ADUs count toward the maximum number of homes on the lot.
column110: Detached ADUs follow NR zone setbacks, but side and rearyard setbacks may be reduced to 0 ft when abutting an alley.
column111: Critical area and overlay provisions in Title 20 may further limit ADU placement.
column112: Hardscape limits apply; remaining area is subject to landscaping and tree standards.

Design_Standards_Notes: ADU allowed attached or detached; detached subject to accessory-structure rules; 1 ADU per lot unless/draft code changes.
Notes: LEGAL STATUS: last adopted ADU code 20.40.210 allows one ADU per lot. Draft 2024 amendments not yet codified — treat as provisional.
column57: Parking required; detached ADU allowed per 20.40.210

Design_Standards_Notes: Design must match principal; metal siding only if primary has it.
Notes: ADUs follow principal setbacks; DADU rear=5ft (0ft alley), side=5ft.

Design_Standards_Notes: ADU setbacks = principal setbacks; DADU: rear 5ft (0ft alley), side 5ft.
Notes: ADU permissions for NR not in provided text.

Design_Standards_Notes: ADU uses principal setbacks per Table 6-2; DADU must follow accessory building setbacks (street not allowed; side 5 ft; rear 5 ft or 0 ft on alley); materials must match principal; 10 ft separation.
Notes: ADU classified as dwelling unit and permitted in UR4 per Table 5-1.

Design_Standards_Notes: ADU uses principal setbacks (0/0/0); DADU must follow accessory setbacks (street prohibited; side 5 ft or 0 ft alley; rear 5 ft or 0 ft alley); 10 ft separation; materials consistent with principal.
Notes: ADU permitted in UR7 because dwelling unit is P in Table 5-1.
DADU_Setback_Notes: Rear setback: 0ft alley, 5ft non-alley; side 5ft non-alley.

Design_Standards_Notes: Mixed use setbacks none; ADU uses principal; DADU accessory rules restrict street setbacks.
